text: I don't know if it has anything to do with "multi-line" or if this even exists in SVG but that's where the alignment is wrong. The first line is too far right. See the attached svg and pdf. This is tested with the latest snapshot (batik-src-10-09-12.zip).
creator: maik.riechert@arcor.de
maik.riechert@arcor.de
text:
Created attachment 26051
PDF produced by batik

creator: helder.magalhaes@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 26054
Fixed SVG

This is a slightly modified version of the original SVG. The only modification needed was removing the trailing space in a tspan: "Collapsed " --> "Collapsed".

The modification demonstrated in comment 3 point towards a duplicate of bug 49736. This means that it is somehow easy to workaround: either change the SVG generation to avoid the trailing space or switch platform (as stated in bug 49736, it appears to be Windows-centric).

Help in determine the specific Java platform bug or a suitable code workaround for Windows is welcome! ;-)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 49736 ***
creator: helder.magalhaes@gmail.com
